result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christina M Forsyth in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Christina M Forsyth.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Trial dates set. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christina M Forsyth in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Christina M Forsyth. Counsel states they have a possible resolution and requests adjournment to finalize. Minutes filed.
Status hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christina M Forsyth not in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Christina M Forsyth. 
Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christina M Forsyth in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Christina M Forsyth. Motion to modify bond by attorney Unger-Keizer. State objects. Argument, granted. Statement by victim. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 6-20-22: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH R.S.G. dob 5-19-1973. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

TOTAL BOND COVERS 22CM319 & 22CM114
Must comply with PreTrial Services. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.S.G. dob 5-19-1973. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Mackenzie Renner. ADA Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  Does qualify for SPD. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
